intro: Coula edulis var. cabrae, commonly known as the African breadfruit, is a tropical tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and yellowish-green fruits. The fruit is typically harvested when fully mature, and its pulp is used as a starchy food source. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. It plays an important role in local ecosystems and traditional agriculture.
